DSS.title: Guest Users are not being properly deleted

figgy.title: GeoServer Event Published after generating a scanned map PDF

comments.body:
A guess would be that this check:

https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/master/app/services/event_generator/geoserver_event_generator.rb#L92

is ignoring the GeoTIFF mime type extension:
https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/master/config/authorities/geo_raster_formats.yml#L2

and matching a plain `image/tiff` instead.

figgy.title: Evaluate Ephemera Subject Heading entry for trained cataloguers

comments.body: My two cents, @tpendragon:  Looking at Ephemera as a whole and as I understand how it was/is? intended to be used, controlled vocabularies are put in place to ensure that collections may be searched not only within their own collections, but throughout the Ephemera collections as a whole. I like the idea of 2a, where the list at large may be chosen from but (certain?) collections may request adding their own things as well. The requests would then be reviewed by the metadata specialist put in charge by Jennifer (currently Rex) and a decision made for that subject to be added to the controlled vocab.

figgy.title: Provide very obvious information that Figgy is staff-only.

comments.body: How about something like this @escowles and @tpendragon? _Figgy is the backend Staff Only Digital Repository system developed at Princeton University Library and is the primary tool used for our digital content management. Once published by staff in Figgy, digital objects are displayed to users in one or more of our many online gateways._

figgy.title: Saving many files on Order Manager is really slow and provides no feedback.

comments.body: I have had feedback regarding this by individuals now working in Order manager for the past two weeks, @tpendragon. I'd say its worth prioritizing this, since the likelihood of having more people contributing to figgy in this way is high.

figgy.title: Typo in download/usage disclaimer on PDFs

comments.body: The URL in the blurb could be updated as well: https://library.princeton.edu/special-collections/policies/forms-citation

figgy.title: 1890 Trenton Sanborns are missing. Re-Ingest & Ensure Figgy Uses existing ARKs

comments.body: How much work would it be to ingest the JP2s? Given the uncertainty of when we'll be able to rephotograph these, it might  make sense to do that if we really can't find the original TIFFs anywhere.

@eliotjordan : @roelmoon found tiff backups on the isilon for the GIS stuff (what they are, unknown...but there is a lot of them. thousands).   In the PUDL share on the isilon: Its in Vol4_pudl_merged_rm. There are 2 subdirectories there for the GIS Archive (/Volumes/pudl/Vol4_pudl_merged_rm/gis ).  we don't know what the numbers mean post PUmap_xxxx.? Is this what you are looking for? Also @escowles re: JP2 bulk ingest into figgy. Is this a question for us? in theory its doable but would figgy try to create jp2s from the jp2s because that's what it does?

Coverage remained the same at 96.484% when pulling **0fe9f6322b4df0f18da0f34c36df3893ebcefa29 on update-homepage2-ad** into **ac320547d6b6d110f8d6d0fe0be28dd1879903cd on master**.

with the icon-bell:
1.![Screen Shot 2020-04-07 at 7 56 14 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/78666422-5b01c100-78a5-11ea-8bec-97d3abafaa6d.png)
2.![Screen Shot 2020-04-07 at 7 55 45 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/78666424-5b9a5780-78a5-11ea-900c-4c7eb2c18aad.png)
3.![Screen Shot 2020-04-07 at 7 54 48 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/78666426-5c32ee00-78a5-11ea-8f03-f9a6086a6485.png)

with the icon-announce:
1.![Screen Shot 2020-04-07 at 7 58 28 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/78666804-e4b18e80-78a5-11ea-91ec-d28e4b310309.png)

Those all look good to me — I like option 3 the best, since it's going in the direction of having the megaphone icon take a similar role to the Hathi icon above, making the multiple boxes look like desktop notifications a little bit.
@escowles I deployed megaphone- option 3 on staging

comments.body: I'm sorry I wrote this ticket poorly. Re-wrote it.

Instead of mapping this into "Notes" a change to the string we send to the "CitedIn" field is the change that can help the RS staff know which record generated a request. (rechecked ILLiad's mapping values for OpenURL).
